Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Dish
Description: This dish was part of a set of four similar ceramic vessels distributed throughout an L-shaped burial pit. The bottom is flat and the body flared with a simple lip.  The clay is fine, common, well fired and buff-coloured and has been polished.
